summary: SummaryHighlightsCruelty FreeGive BackBubble's Bounce Back Balancing Toner Mist instantly resets skin, adding hydration and balance while cutting mid-day shine. Throw it in your bag and stay toned on-the-go.
details: DetailsBenefitsAll skin types: dry, oily, combinationFragrance freeKey IngredientsSea Water helps mattify and reduce the appearance of pores.Sodium PCA + Niacinamide help improve texture and radiance.Willow Bark Extract gently exfoliates while calming redness and reducing oiliness.Formulated WithoutDenatured alcoholsParabensArtificial colorAdded fragranceItem 2619147How To UseSpray 3-5 inches from face for an instant skin reset anytime.Precautions: Use only as directed.IngredientsWater (Aqua), Rosa Damascena Flower Water, Glycerin, Pentylene Glycol, Leuconostoc/Radish Root Ferment Filtrate, Sea Water, Sodium PCA, Niacinamide, Citric Acid, Salix Nigra (Willow) Bark Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Echinacea Purpurea Extract, Echinacea Angustifolia Root Extract, Echinacea Purpurea Root Extract, Sodium Benzoate, Potassium Sorbate, Sodium Phytate, Citronellol, Geraniol, Linalool.
how_to_use: Spray 3-5 inches from face for an instant skin reset anytime.Precautions: Use only as directed.

reviews.headline: will DEFINITELY buy again
reviews.comments: three days ago I bought this, and I didn't think that my skin was going to change this much within such a short timeframe. not to mention this product is sold at such a great price. I would recommend this to anyone that has redness, or acne prone skin. all of my blemishes that i had are gone and my skin hasn't looked this good in years. my skin tone is so balanced and hydrated throughout the whole day. i use this morning and night. and i am so happy i found it. this brand single-handedly saved my skin!

media.caption: Love it

faceoff_positive.comments: A few years ago, I developed extremely sensitive eczema and rosacea prone skin out of nowhere. I'm sure my skin conditions are symptoms of my autoimmune conditions because I also get hormonal acne that's almost impossible to treat topically.      My usual skincare products are around 3x the price than this, and I hadn't even heard of this brand, let alone considered trying it before a friend recommended it to me. And honestly, despite the good ingredient list, I really wasn't expecting anything when I first tried it. But shockingly, I loved everything I got.      I started out applying this as one of the last steps in my routine before bed, and I was amazed at how this lightweight moisturizer was able to keep my skin supple throughout the night. But don't get me wrong, I wouldn't consider this product an occlusive at all. it's more hydrating than moisturizing.      I grab for now during the day now as well. I actually prefer it more for daytime use. Currently, summer's just beginning and the weather in my area is already a sweltering, humid 95 degrees. I love applying this in the morning because it has such a refreshing, cooling, silky, gel-like formula that doesn't pill, feel heavy under or sweats your makeup off, or cause any extra oiliness throughout the day. It feels even better kept in the fridge!     For reference, the formula/ texture/ results of this moisturizer is very comparable to Purito's Sea Buckthorn Vital 70 Cream and their Deep Sea Pure Water Cream.      This's great for those who have combination or oilier skin types and want hydration without feeling weighed down. However, if you have broken skin or a compromised/ damaged skin barrier, like from eczema or something, this may sting a little when first applied. I mean for the price point, it's amazing!
faceoff_positive.headline: Shockingly Surprised

faceoff_negative.comments: I bought this product like a week ago and to be honest I havent seen much of a difference at all. Im still going to continue to use this but im not sure ill see a visible difference. I have acne prone and oily skin. Im sure its doing a difference deep in my skin thats just not visible. But I recommend this for other people despite my issues anyways!
faceoff_negative.headline: Okay
